topics.body:
"@HeroInferno":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b3dccd6368721012000d90#post_55b3dccd6368721012000d90
Not to mention people who live in Brazil. Gaming would be _*extinct*_.


"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b3dcb96368725ab000046d#post_55b3dcb96368725ab000046d
At that point there would be no reason to even create IP's anymore.

Everything would be fucking dead. And there would be no chance of your IP getting ANYWHERE.

As someone who wants to create cool shit I say burn this Law to the ground, Burn it so hard satan uses it as a bonfire to cuddle against when he's feeling cooled in HELL.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@HeroInferno":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b3dccd6368721012000d90#post_55b3dccd6368721012000d90
I wouldn't say it would flat out die all together, rather it would make it would insta-kill the console gaming industry.  The TPP mainly effects *physical sales*; as in trading video game disc sales and sales of physical hardware and that.  Basically if you want a ps4 in the uk say hello to double the price on top of that and double the price of the physical copies of sales.

The group that is probably going to make out like thieves is pc digital downloads because that would primarily be unaffected.


The reason why anime is pretty fucked is that japan relies heavily on physical exports of dvds and manga and that.

The reason why consoles are fucked is that they rely heavily on physical exports of game discs.

The reason why comic books are fucked is that they rely heavily on physical exports of comic books and dvds of the movies.

And make it incredibly difficult for media products to be shipped internationally and most *physical* forms of media would receive a massive price hike.

Want to buy a physical copy of a game? That will be $150
Want to buy a physical copy of dvd of mlp season 1?  That will be $150
Want to buy a ps4?  That will be $1600
